{{also|oma|OMA|omã|Omã|omā|öma|-oma}} ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈoːma/}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈɔma/}} {{a|chiefly western German}} * {{audio|de|De-Oma.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f|Omas|gen2=Oma|Omas}} # [[grandma]], [[granny]], [[nan]] # any [[elderly]] [[woman]] ====Usage notes==== * The word is commonly used with a definite article in most parts of central Germany, southern Germany, and Austria: ''Wo ist die Oma?'' – “Where is Grandma?” In northern Germany—and generally in writing—no article tends to be used: ''Wo ist Oma?'' ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|s}} * Genitive without preceding article (i.e. when used as a proper noun): {{l|de|Omas}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Omi}} {{qualifier|affectionate}} * {{l|de|Uroma}} ===Synonyms=== * {{l|de|Altmutter}} * {{l|de|Großmama}} * {{l|de|Großmutter}} ===Antonyms=== * {{l|de|Opa}} ([[Altvater]], [[Großpapa]], [[Großvater]], [[Opi]]) * {{l|de|Enkelin}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} {{topics|de|Family members|Female}}
